questions.text: Correlate between the two images and give your diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) The images show adenoma sebaceum and ash leaf macule seen in Tuberous sclerosis. EXTRA EDGE ? Most reliable early cutaneous sign of Tuberous sclerosis is Ash leaf macule ? Most commonly recognised cutaneous marker of Tuberous sclerosis is Adenoma sebaceum.

questions.text: The condition shown below occurs due to?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Rhinophyma(potato nose) occurs due to sebaceous gland hypertrophy.It is a glandular form of acne rosacea. EXTRA EDGE ? Enlarged hilar and mediastinal nodes in sarcoidosis are called “potato nodes”

questions.text: The typical hair pattern shown in image is seen in?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) “Exclamation mark” hairs are seen in Alopecia areata

questions.text: A 25 year old male presents with erythematous raised lesions in the body.Examination finding of his hand is also shown below.What is your diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) A Psoriasis is grouped under papulosquamous disorders.It presents with well demarcated erythematous raised papules and plaques,covered by silvery micaceous scales.The lesions preferentially affect extensor aspects of trunk(back and lumbosacral area) and limbs (elbow,knee).Nail changes that occur in psoriasis are shown in image below: EXTRA EDGE Guttate psoriasis is associated with beta-hemolytic streptococci infection.

questions.text: The nail finding shown below is associated with ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) In 10-20% of patients with Lichen planus,longitudinal ridging,grooving and scarring leads to dorsal “pterygium” formation EXTRA EDGE Lichen planus may be associated with Hepatitis C infection

questions.text: A 24 year old male developed an annular skin lesion on the trunk.One week later,he developed many small such lesions on the trunk,as shown in image below.What is your diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) The first manifestation of pityriasis rosea is the development of a 2 to 6 cm annular lesion known as “Herald patch”.This is followed in a few days to few weeks by the appearance of many smaller annular or popular skin lesions with a predilection to occur in the trunk.This is often seen in a “fir tree pattern” with typical peripheral collarette scales EXTRA EDGE ? The most important differential diagnosis of Pityriasis rosea is skin lesions of Secondary syphilis.The differentiating feature is that palms and sole lesions are extremely rare in Pityriasis rosea and common in secondary syphilis.

questions.text: What sign is being demonstrated in this patient?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) “Asboe Hansen sign” or “Bulla spread sign” means when you apply gentle pressure on an intact bulla,the fluid spreads away under the skin away from the site of pressure.This spread occurs because of loss of desmosomes(acantholysis). This sign is positive in all varieties of pemphigus and many cases of subepidermal blisters, including bullous pemphigoid, dermatitis herpetiformis, epidermolysis bullosa acquisita, cicatricial pemphigoid, dystrophic epidermolysis bullosa, Stevens-Johnson syndrome and toxic epidermal necrolysis. EXTRA EDGE ? Skin biopsy of Pemphigus vulgaris on Direct Immunofluorescence shows “Fish net pattern”

questions.text: A 30 year old female presentswith well defined,irregular brown red plaques on both shins(Image shown below).What could be the possible underlying systemic disorder she may have?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) The diagnosis is “Necrobiosis lipoidica diabeticorum” which is seen in young female diabetics.Treatment is with steroids,but often unsatisfactory.Chronic stage of this condition may present as ulcers.

questions.text: A patient with which of the following dermatological conditions can have X-ray findings as shown below?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) The X-ray shows the characteristic “pencil in cup deformity” seen in psoriatic arthritis. EXTRA EDGE ? Wright and Moll classification is for Psoriatic arthropathy

questions.text: The instrument shown below is used in the diagnosis of ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) The instrument shown in the image is the Wood’s lamp.It can aid the diagnosis of all the three conditions based on fluorescence pattern. EXTRA EDGE ? Fluorescence patterns in Wood’s lamp is various conditions; Tinea capitis-Yellowish fluorescence Pityriasis versicolor-Golden yellow fluorescence Erythrasma-Coral red fluorescence Vitiligo-Total white

questions.text: The findings in the image below is most likely to be associated with which nutritional dermatoses?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) The image shows perifollicular hemorrhages typical of Scurvy.The follicles are often plugged by keratin(perifollicular hyperkeratosis). EXTRA EDGE ? Infantile scurvy is also known as Barlow’s disease.

questions.text: A 2 year old child presents with patches and crusted plaques in face,neck and extensor surfaces of the body.Additional finding is shown in the image.What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) The clinical history as well as the finding of Denny-Morgan fold(extrafold of skin beneath the lower eyelid) is suggestive of Atopic dermatitis.

questions.text: A 6 year old boy presented with recurrent scaly lesions on face as shown in image.What is the most probable diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) -Pityriasis Alba , primarily seen in children , presents as hypopigmented "scaly" macule ( face) Biopsy : IOC ( perineural , Periappendageal Lymphocytosis) - Indeterminate Leprosy : Ill defined hypopigmented macule . SCALING - absent Sensation - Normal - Tinea versicolor can present with scaly hypopigmented scaly macule ,seen more commonly in adults .

questions.text: The test demonstrated in the image is based on which type of hypersensitivity?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Patch test is the gold standard for the diagnosis of allergic dermatitis.It is based on delayed(type IV)hypersensitivity.

questions.text: Spot diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Intensly itchy,erythematous scaly “coin shaped” lesions are a feature of nummular eczema/dermatitis

questions.text: The histopathology image shown below points to a diagnosis of ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) The characterisitic histological changes seen in Lichen planus are; i)Basal epidermal cell degeneration causing saw tooth appearance of rete pegs and eosinophilic cytoid bodies(Civatte bodies) ii)Epidermal thickening,especially of granular cell layer iii)Sub-epidermal lichenoid band due to deposition of lymphocytes and histiocytes. iv)Max Joseph spaces or small areas of artifactual separation between the epidermis and the dermis

questions.text: The histopathology image shown below is most consistent with a diagnosis of ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) The histopathology shows suprabasal acantholysis with “row of tombstone” appearance

questions.text: A 6 year old boy presents with lesions on dorsal aspect of hands and genitals as shown in image.What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Lichen nitidus presents as multiple grouped pinhead sized shiny papules mainly in children. Cause unknown. Sites-genitals, arms. Biopsy has a “claw clutching a ball” appearance. Usually self limiting. Topical steroids and tacrolimus may be used.

questions.text: A 35 year old male presents with intensly pruritic papulovesicular lesions in hus buttocks.Biopsy was taken and HPE slide is shown below.What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Dermatitis herpetiformis is an intensely pruritic,papulovesicular skin disease characterised by lesions symmetrically distributed over extensor surfaces.(ie:elbows,knees,buttocks,back,scalp). Biopsy reveals neutrophil rich infiltrates within dermal papillae. EXTRA EDGE ? Direct immunofluorescence in Dermatitis herpetiformis reveals granular IgA deposition in the epidermal basement membrane zone

questions.text: A 25 year old male developed sudden onset rapidly spreading lesions on hand as shown in image.What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) The image shows Target lesions/Iris lesions/Bull’s eye lesions/Annular lesions seen in Erythema multiforme.The lesions are symmetric,develop abruptly and rapidly spreading. EXTRA EDGE ? The most common cause of Erythema multiforme is Herpes Simplex virus-1(HSV-1)

questions.text: A 2 year old child with high fever developed toxic look,eruptions as shown in image along with fissuring and cracking of lips.What is the most probable diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) The clinical history is most consistent with a diagnosis of Kawasaki disease. Diagnostic Criteria for Kawasaki disease A.Fever lasting for at least 5 days B.Presence of at least four of the following five signs: Bilateral bulbar conjunctival injection, generally nonpurulent. Changes in the mucosa of the oropharynx, including injected pharynx, injected and/or dry fissured lips, strawberry tongue. Changes of the peripheral extremities, such as edema and/or erythema of the hands or feet in the acute phase; or periungual desquamation in the subacute phase Rash, primarily truncal; polymorphous but nonvesicular Cervical adenopathy, ≥1.5 cm, usually unilateral lymphadenopathy EXTRA EDGE Cardiac involvement is the most important manifestation of Kawasaki disease. Myocarditis manifested by tachycardia and decreased ventricular function occurs in at least 50% of patients. Pericarditis with a small pericardial effusion is common during the acute illness. Coronary artery aneurysms generally develop in up to 25% of untreated patients during the 2nd-3rd wk of illness. Giant coronary artery aneurysms (≥8 mm internal diameter) pose the greatest risk for rupture, thrombosis or stenosis, and myocardial infarction.

questions.text: The patient is most likely to be suffering from which sexually transmitted disease?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) The image shows “Groove sign” seen in Lymphogranuloma venereum.This sign is due to involvement of inguinal nodes above and below the inguinal ligament.

questions.text: Which form of leprosy shows the pattern of lesion shown in image?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) The image shows “satellite lesions” seen in Borderline tuberculoid type of leprosy.

questions.text: A 24 year old male who is a diagnosed case of tuberculosis develops lesions on trunk as shown below.What is the most probable diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Lichen scrofulosorum is a type of tuberculid occurring in young patients with underlying tuberculosis.There is lichenoid eruption of papules involving perifollicular distribution on abdomen,chest,back and proximal limbs.

questions.text: A 28 yea old rugby player comes to the OPD with skin lesion shown in image.What is the most probable diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) The history of contact sports(rugby) along with skin lesion showing central clearing is seen in Tinea corporis. EXTRA EDGE ? Central scarring is seen in Lupus vulgaris ? Central crusting is seen in Cutaneous Leishmaniasis

questions.text: A 18 year old girl living in hostel complaints of itching in scalp.Section of hair shaft is shown in image.What is the most probable diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) The hair shaft shows pediculosis capitis egg.

questions.text: A 60 year old male presented with lesion in the face.Biopsy was taken and HPE slide is shown in image.What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) The histopathology shows the characteristic “peripheral palisading” seen in basal cell carcinoma.

questions.text: The finding shown in image may be seen in?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) The image shows Acanthosis nigricans which may be seen in all these conditions. Morphology: Hyper-pigmented velvety plaques Site: Neck, Axilla Most common cause: Obesity MOA: Obesity leads to production of insulin like growth factor > Stimulates Epidermal Keratinocytes

questions.text: The KOH mount shown in image is characteristic of ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) The KOH mount shows “spaghetti-and-meatball” appearance seen in Pityriasis versicolor

questions.text: A 55 year old male patient has been having skin lesions over elbow (shown in image) for the past 4 years.He has seen many dermatologists,but no diagnosis could not be made.His doctor now ordered for a biopsy and HPE slide image is shown below.What is the most probable diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Mycosis fungoides is an indolent lymphoma with patients often having several years of eczematous or dermatitis skin lesions before the diagnosis is finally established.The skin lesions progress from patch stage to plaque stage to cutaneous tumor stage.Histologically, the epidermis and upper dermis are infiltrated by neoplastic T cells(epidermotropism) either as single cells and small clusters (Pautrier microabscesses).

questions.text: A pregnant female presents with lesions in genitilia as shown in image.Which of the treatment modalities is not recommended?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Podophyllin is contraindicated in the treatment of Condyloma acuminata (venereal warts) in pregnancy as it is teratogenic

questions.text: A 40 year old farmer presents with lesions on his forearm(shown in image).Colony of the organism on special stain is also shown below.What is the diagnosis ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Sporotrichosis is seen in farmers following penetrating injury by plant product(thorn).It is also known as Rose Gardener’s disease.It presents as subcutaneous nodules which may break down to form ulcers.Cigar shaped yeasts of Sporothrix is shown in the image in question

questions.text: A 27-year-old sexually active man presents to the OPD with the following finding. He informs you that a few days ago, he developed an erythematous vesicular lesion at the same location within hours of taking a drug. What is the diagnosis
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) FDE The characteristic lesion healing with hyperpigmentation following drug intake is consistent with fixed drug eruption. NSAIDs are the most commonly implicated drug. Fixed drug eruption (FDE) is a cutaneous adverse drug reaction characterized by recurrent well-defined lesions occurring at the same sites each time the offending drug is taken. It typically presents 30 min to 8 h after drug exposure

questions.text: A 35-year old man with a history of high-risk sexual behavior presents with the following painless penile ulcer. It bleeds on touch and there are no enlarged lymph nodes. What is the diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Granuloma inguinale This man with a painless, vascular ulcer and no lymphadenopathy has granuloma inguinale. The first-line treatment is azithromycin 1 g orally once weekly or 500 mg daily for 3 weeks.

questions.text: A 16-year-old boy presents with skin lesions over the dorsum of the hand as shown below. On examination, the lesions are firm papules with a rough horny surface. What is the most common causative agent of these lesions?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Human Papilloma virus-2 The clinical scenario and image showing multiple firm papules with a rough horny surface on the dorsum are suggestive of Verruca vulgaris or a common wart. The most common causative agent of common wart is the Human Papillomavirus-2 (HPV-2).

questions.text: What is the probable diagnosis of this condition affecting hair?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Trichothiodystrophy The given clinical image of hair seen under polarising microscopy reveals tiger tail banding (alternating light and dark bands) characteristic of trichothiodystrophy. Trichothiodystrophy is an autosomal recessive condition causing defective DNA repair. It causes brittle sulfur- deficient hair, photosensitivity, ichthyosis and systemic involvement. Unlike xeroderma pigmentosum (a similar condition with defective DNA repair), there is no risk of skin cancer.

questions.text: A child presents to you with itchy lesions on the scalp with hair loss as shown in the image below. What would be the next best step?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) KOH mount The above image shows tinea capitis, which presents with a well-demarcated scaly patch in which hair shafts are broken off just above the skin( black dot like appearance) resulting in alopecia, KOH mount is useful for the depicted condition. The scrapings should be taken from the edge of a lesion and transferred to a slide, to which KOH is added and examined under the microscope for the presence of hyphae. Tinea capitis is a dermatophyte infection primarily occurring in children. Clinical features of tinea capitis are patchy hair loss, scaling, tender lymphadenopathy, and in severe cases, there might be pustules and crusting of the affected area.

questions.text: As a first-year dermatology resident, you see a patient with the following skin lesion. Which of the following disorders is least likely to present in this form?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Pemphigus vulgaris Explanation: The image shows well-demarcated, red plaques with prominent silvery scales, a classic appearance for a psoriasiform dermatitis. Pemphigus vulgaris is an autoimmune blistering disease characterized by flaccid blisters and erosions, not scaly plaques. Therefore, it is the least likely to present in this form. Incorrect Options: Option A. Reiter’s disease Explanation: Reiter's disease (Reactive Arthritis) can present with keratoderma blennorrhagicum, which are skin lesions that are clinically and histologically indistinguishable from psoriasis. This morphology is consistent with the image. Option B. Secondary syphilis Explanation: Secondary syphilis is known as "the great mimicker" and can present with a wide variety of skin lesions, including papulosquamous eruptions that can be psoriasiform (mimicking psoriasis). This morphology is a possible presentation. Option C. Mycosis fungoides Explanation: In its early stages (patch and plaque stages), Mycosis fungoides (a type of cutaneous T-cell lymphoma) can present with erythematous, scaly patches and plaques that can resemble psoriasis. This morphology is a known presentation.

questions.text: An 11-year-old child presented with a pruritic lesion as shown. Which of the following is the drug of choice for this condition?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Griseofulvin The image shows a scaly pruritic lesion affecting the scalp hair, suggestive of tinea capitis. The drug of choice treatment for children in whom the cause of tinea capitis is unclear is griseofulvin. Terbinafine is the alternate first-line drug for adults.

questions.text: The arrow depicted in the image is an important histopathological feature of which of the following conditions?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Lichen planus The vacuolated degeneration of the basal epithelial cell layers can occasionally lead to larger slit-like clefts known as Max-Joseph's spaces

questions.text: A 20-year-old girl who is a known case of atopic dermatitis presents with multiple, pruritic pustular lesions for 5 days. Which of the following organism is commonly responsible for her condition?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Staphylococcus aureus The above image showing pustular lesions with heavy crusting in a patient with atopic dermatitis is suggestive of staphylococcal infection. Staphylococcus aureus is the most common organism to cause secondary infections in the lesions of atopic dermatitis. However, human papillomavirus-induced warts, fungal infections, and viruses (such as HSV, vaccinia, coxsackie A, and the poxvirus of molluscum contagiosum) are also frequent pathogens.

questions.text: A 45-year-old obese male patient presents with these lesions over her neck. What is your diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Acanthosis nigricans is a common condition characterized by velvety, hyperpigmented plaques on the skin. Sites affected: Neck and axillae. Inguinal folds may also be involved Most common association: Obesity Pathogenesis: Hyperinsulinemia plays a key role in the development of acanthosis nigricans. Elevated levels of insulin may stimulate keratinocyte and dermal fibroblast proliferation via interaction with IGFR1 (Insulin-like growth factor receptor-1), resulting in the plaque-like lesions that typify the disorder

questions.text: A 30-year-old man presents with the following skin finding. Which of the following clinical tests will aid in diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Grattage test The presence of silvery-white scaly plaques on the extensor aspect of elbows and knees is a characteristic feature of psoriasis. Grattage test aids in its diagnosis. Scratching (grattage) scales in psoriasis makes the scale appear more silver in color by introducing air-keratin interfaces. When the scales are completely scraped off, the basement membrane is exposed and is seen as a moist red surface (membrane of Bulkeley) through which dilated capillaries at the tip of elongated dermal papillae are torn, leading to multiple bleeding points. This classical pinpoint bleeding is known as the Auspitz sign.

questions.text: While examining a patient in the dermatology OPD, the senior resident elicits the following finding. What condition does this patient likely have?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Dermographism This clinical scenario is suggestive of dermographism, which is commonly elicited in chronic urticaria patients. It is an urticarial reaction in response to pressure or trauma to the skin. It is the most common type of inducible urticaria.

questions.text: Identify the finding associated with the condition shown in the image below.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Isomorphic phenomenon The image shows plaque psoriasis of the dorsum of the hand, and isomorphic or Koebner phenomenon is associated with the condition.

questions.text: Identify the condition shown in the image below.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Lichen planus It is a common inflammatory disorder that can affect any ectodermal-derived tissue. Cutaneous lichen planus typically presents as a papulosquamous eruption with flat-topped, violaceous, papular lesions of varying size, often described using the ‘‘six P’s’’ (purple, pruritic, polygonal, planar, papules and plaques) and characterised by the classic Wickham striae. The lesions of lichen planus are often symmetrically distributed over the extremities, mainly involving the flexors.

questions.text: A 30-year-old female presents with subtle, fine, reticulate lacy-white, papules on the vulva, and the following cutaneous finding. Choose the most appropriate treatment strategy.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Topical steroids The image shows purple, polygonal, flat-topped papules and plaques along with Wickham’s striae on the dorsum of the hand, and similar lesions present on the vulva, the age of the patient point towards a diagnosis of lichen planus. The main treatment in the case of persistent lichen planus is steroids

questions.text: A 40-year-old man presented to the dermatology OPD. He was diagnosed with pityriasis rubra pilaris. Which of the following features is least likely to be found in this patient?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Herald patch Herald patch is seen in pityriasis rosea. The image shows prominent erythema and scale on the palms of the hands and wrists with marked orange-yellow palmoplantar keratoderma which is a feature of pityriasis rubra pilaris.

questions.text: A patient presented to the dermatology OPD with the following finding. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Psoriasis The given image shows a typical erythematous psoriatic plaque with silvery-white scales. The site of predilection in psoriasis is usually extensor areas, scalp, pam and sole.

questions.text: Which of the following test shown below?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Wood’s lamp examination A Wood's lamp examination is a quick and painless test that uses ultraviolet light to examine the skin, scalp, and hair. It can help diagnose skin conditions like fungal and bacterial infections, vitiligo, and pigment disorders

choices.text: Fusidic acid cream twice daily for 10 days

questions.text: What is the best treatment for the image depicted below
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Orolabial herpes has been shown in the image and is also termed as fever blister/ cold sores. Orolabial herpes produced by HSV-1 presents clinically as grouped vesicles with history of recurrences Tzanck Smear reveals multinucleated giant cells Treatment: T. Acyclovir 400mg TID for 5 days

questions.text: A patient with female pattern hairloss, which classification system is used ?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Ludwig staging The above picture shows female pattern hair loss with frontoparietal thinning and maintenance of the frontal hairline. Female pattern hair loss staging is done using the Ludwig staging.
